name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's definition of law and order, argue @benjaminwittes and @qjurecic, is that "those who oppose him should be punished and those who support him—or simply those for whom he has solicitude—should be free to do as they please." https://t.co/JeJ4VSwyDN

name: TheAtlantic
text: What would it take for Republican leaders to admit to themselves that Trump’s loyalty cult is destroying the country its members claim to love? @anneapplebaum asks in our July/August cover story, up now. https://t.co/WDr8Rd1Nmh https://t.co/ELA55aQaEx

name: TheAtlantic
text: Earlier this year, @jpinsk was asked to give a commencement speech, but once the pandemic hit, he didn’t know what to say. So he asked a novelist, a therapist, a Buddhist teacher, and 16 other experts for their advice: https://t.co/Bw5j8mZosy

name: TheAtlantic
text: The HBO Max documentary “On the Record” is about a broken system and an alleged abuser. But it is more profoundly about the women whose careers were ended by pervasive sexism in the music industry, @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/GPVsJ31cZ0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Antifa traces its roots to Europe in the 1920s and ’30s, but for a long time the movement didn’t occupy the American spotlight. Trump changed that, @PeterBeinart wrote in 2017. The result has been explosive growth. https://t.co/aiEAQRK383

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lady Gaga's "Chromatica" tries to access the joy of pop as a sensory experience. But the context of 2020 turmoil makes it land strangely. @skornhaber reviews the singer's return to the dance floor: https://t.co/jl7A7hWJkf

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: The Works of Christo via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/PBGPifJ6Al

name: TheAtlantic
text: Amid protests around the country, Trump wanted to be seen as strong. And he was willing to deploy the federal government’s firepower to make it happen, writes @PeterAtlantic: https://t.co/upBzMqGIXb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The First Amendment is no good if it is used to protect one side of the political spectrum but disregarded for the other," @AttorneyNora writes: https://t.co/G7KrMg1yoF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidfrum: Trump Is not the Richard Nixon of 1968. He’s the Mayor Daley and George Wallace of 1968. Latest in ⁦@TheAtlantic⁩  https://t.co/3WawFQaIIm

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @elcush: History Will Judge The Complicit https://t.co/8Yb7nqPkR9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: "Each violation of our Constitution and our civic peace gets absorbed, rationalized, and accepted by people who once upon a time knew better. If ... Trump wins a second term, these people may well accept even worse."

Don't miss @anneapplebaum's latest:
https://t.co/245U8EEm1z

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "In the span of 20 minutes, President Donald Trump manufactured a moment meant to showcase two qualities he’s never really displayed: physical courage and religious feeling." -- @PeterAtlantic:
https://t.co/Tgh9RJNVZ0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Read Ai Weiwei on the pandemic (via @TheAtlantic):
https://t.co/ycwrbNrHKx

name: TheAtlantic
text: It’s been one week since George Floyd died after being pinned under the knee of a Minnesota police officer. The scene in the country now rivals that of 1968. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/AixH8u4iZ2

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "...Time erases faith. There are no eulogies, no last words, and the corpses are no longer moved to manicured graveyards. They are put in refrigerated trucks, brought to parking lots."

Read Ai Weiwei on everything we've lost:
https://t.co/ycwrbNrHKx

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "In Washington ... protesters were fleeing up 16th Street, blinking tear gas from their eyes, because one man wanted a picture of himself holding a Bible at a church." - @PeterAtlantic: https://t.co/ExEn3hGObC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: The message Republicans are sending Steve King, whose primary is today, is not a condemnation of his racist comments, but a broader denunciation for an even graver political sin: putting a safe seat in danger, reports @elainejgodfrey: https://t.co/ahgRIE0hCg

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @Yascha_Mounk: If you want to understand why, even now, so many high-ranking Republicans are complicit in Donald Trump's attacks on American democracy, you *must* read this brilliant cover story by @anneapplebaum for @TheAtlantic.

https://t.co/3ESQbWFTWO

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: What is time anymore? Read @aiww on space, location, scale, and time as "the undergirding of self-knowledge." https://t.co/w6WWuCbCIi

name: TheAtlantic
text: “There are no eulogies, no last words, and the corpses are no longer moved to manicured graveyards,” Ai Weiwei writes. “One loses belief in the government, in parents, in neighbors, in the very possibility that life will continue.” https://t.co/2LU960Ma7V

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: George Will calls on Trump's congressional enablers to be removed. In this cover story from @TheAtlantic, @anneapplebaum explores why so many Republican leaders collaborate with Trump:
https://t.co/x2pfe5shFv

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "The message Republicans are sending to King is not a condemnation of his racist comments, but rather a broader denunciation for an even graver political sin: putting a safe seat in danger." Always read @elainejgodfrey on Steve King, whose primary is today https://t.co/2qSWT0HwyK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's stunt last night—with its mix of shallow credal signaling and brutish force—was emblematic of his appeal to the religious right, @mckaycoppins writes. https://t.co/tACcmKbniC

name: TheAtlantic
text: From seizing control of the internet to declaring martial law, Trump may legally do all kinds of extraordinary things during a state of emergency. @LizaGoitein outlines the special provisions that become available to the president. https://t.co/gNQy6rLFJi https://t.co/BcSvZADayH
